title: EuroBulk Paper-Logo
content:
Hi,

After trying to find this font for days i ask you to help.  
This font is similar to DIN-Mittelschrift.  
I would be realy thankful if anybody knows it.

my best,  
jan

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091203150753im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/EuroBulk_6717.jpg)
author: jansen

comments.content:
It is DIN, modified.  
Quite common to modify typefaces for logotypes.

I’m inclined to say:  
If it has ‘finger’ terminals and it’s not [on this list](http://web.archive.org/web/20091203150753/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/genres/soft_sans_curve_to_corner/), the typeface in question is probably the result of a non-typedesigning graphic designer who tinkered with some poor font.

Florian, I think you put too much faith in that list. I would be very surprised if that list is very complete, as almost all of the similar FontShop lists I have seen are just a sampling of a particular style (and I think limited to FontShop availability).

- Mike Yanega

Well, I should have added a winking smiley!  
It’s just that there is only a handful of good ‘curve-to-corner’ typefaces around. Most of the other sightings are like this one: swift corner manipulation, for a logo or a ‘custom typeface’.  
Are you planning an unbiased Bowfins Printworks Finger Sans ID Guide? Would be fantastic!

It’s an idea!

However, I think I already have included some of this sort of font in the Script Font ID Guide, because the ’finger terminals’ make them look more like brush-drawn lettering. Cocon, Maiandra, Textile and some other similar styles are already in the Script Guide. I’m always looking for sample donors Florian, if you want to make some.

- Mike Yanega
Is there a donation waiting list?

Do you mean a font wanted ’waiting list’? There is one for the Script Guide, but I didn’t have some of these Sans fonts on it, as they are rather borderline as Scripts, even in my broad definition. I’d like to also get them into the new interactive [Sans Serif Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20091203150753/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/SansGuide/sanssearch.php), which Jan and I are trying to bring up to date.

- Mike Yanega
